Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' in 200 words.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure, so it will target Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of approximately 2. The Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level is calculated as:

The word 'prehistory' means the time before people started writing things down. This period covers the lives of early humans like our ancestors, who lived in caves and hunted animals for food. They didn't have books or computers, so we can't read about their lives. Archaeologists study things they made, like tools and art, to learn about this time.

LaTeX code for the final paragraph:

\\begin{document}

\\textbf{Prehistory} is the time before people started writing things down. This period covers the lives of early humans like our ancestors, who lived in caves and hunted animals for food. They didn't have books or computers, so we can't read about their lives. Archaeologists study things they made, like tools and art, to learn about this time.

\\end{document}

Final paragraph: "Long ago, before people wrote history, was a time called prehistory. This time began when humans first appeared, around 6 million years back. In prehistory, people lived as hunters and gatherers, moving from place to place. They used tools made from stones and bones. There were no books, no schools, no governments. People lived in small groups called tribes. Prehistory ended when people started writing things down, around 3,400 years ago."

"Prehistory is the time before written records began. It is the period when people lived as hunters and gatherers, moving from place to place. They used tools made from stones and bones. These early people did not write down their stories or history. So, we learn about them from digging up their old things, like tools and bones. This is called archaeology. Archaeologists help us understand what life was like long ago, even though we cannot read about it."

Prehistory is the time before people started writing. It ends around 3300 BC. This period covers when early humans first used tools. It also includes when people started farming and making cities. Archaeologists study prehistory by looking at old stones, bones, and art. They learn about how people lived without words.
